role.descr: strength (amount of active ingredient): May be represented as the mass-quantity of the active ingredient(s) in a single whole unit, or the ratio (percentage-entity) of the active ingredient to the whole substance
total amount (mass or volume) of substance for a single, whole form (ARG2) of the medication (includes active and inactive ingredients)
total amount of a course of medication (most often used for cycles of chemotherapy or fractions of radiation)

example.name: Arg1, Arg2, Arg3, Arg4
example.text: Coumadin 5-mg tablet one-half-tablet twice a day.
example.amr: (t / therapy-01 :implicit + :ARG2 (m / medications-drugs :name (n / name :op1 "Coumadin") :ARG1-of (d2 / dose-entity-91 :ARG2 (t2 / tablet :quant "1/2") :ARG3 (m2 / mass-quantity :quant 5 :unit (m3 / milligram)) :ARG4 (r / rate-entity-91 :ARG1 2 :ARG2 (t3 / temporal-quantity :quant 1 :unit (d3 / day)))))))

example.note: If :ARG2 isn't explicit, don't infer; we assume that the :ARG3 mass amount is what's being ingested at the given frequency, regardless of the number or mass of tablets.
example.amr: :op1 (m2 / medications-drugs :name (n2 / name :op1 "metoprolol") :ARG1-of (d3 / dose-entity-91 :ARG2 (t2 / thing :quant 1) :ARG3 (m3 / mass-quantity :quant 100 :unit (m4 / milligram)) :ARG4 (r / rate-entity-91 :ARG1 2 :ARG2 (t3 / temporal-quantity :quant 1 :unit (d / day)))))
